c74object.name: bach.toc&r
c74object.description: Accepts an llll of elements and an llll of reference durations: the element of the former corresponding to non-negative reference durations (non-rest elements) are output from the first outlet, while the ones corresponding to negative reference durations (rest elements) are output from the second outlet. Third outlet outputs the position of rest element, for a future reassembling of the llll via bach.fromc&r.

outlet.digest: The elements corresponding to non-negative durations (non-rest elements)
The elements corresponding to negative durations (rest elements)
Indices of rest elements for future reinsertion

method.name: bang
method.digest: Output position indices and routed lllls
method.description: Outputs the results (see the llll method) based on most recently received input lllls.

method.name: llll
method.digest: Set llll or reference durations llll, output result
method.description:
An llll in the first inlet is considered as the llll containing the elements to route. Unless the triggers attribute is set to 2, this also outputs the result: the indices of elements corresponding to negative durations in the reference durations llll are output from the third outlet; the elements situated in the same position of negative elements of the reference durations llll are collected and output from the second outlet; finally the elements situated in the same position of non-negative elements of the reference durations llll are collected and output from the first outlet.
An llll in the second inlet sets the reference durations llll. If the triggers attribute is 2, it also triggers the output of the results (see above).
The two lllls must have the same structure, and can either be plain lllls, or lists of plain lllls, in which case they are considered as being one list for each voice.

attribute.name: out
attribute.description:
The out attribute is a sequence of characters identifying the outlet types (one character for each llll outlet). Characters can be one of the following:
n (default): 'native' output: faster and more precise between bach objects, but unreadable by standard Max objects (an "bach.llll" message appears instead).
t: 'text' output: slower and limited in size, but readable by standard Max objects. A plain llll in text format is a generic Max message. To keep the representation invertible (i.e., to allow a bach object receiving a text-format llll to interpret it exactly as if it was native format, e

attribute.name: triggers
attribute.description: Index of the inlet triggering the output; this can be 0, 1 or 2 (0 meaning: all inlets; the default is 1: left inlet).

c74object.discussion: bach.toc&r is especially useful in combination with bach.fromc&r in order to perform different operations on the set of elements corresponding to rests and to non-rests.

entry.name: Outlet 1 (llll)
entry.description: The elements corresponding to non-negative durations (non-rest elements).

entry.name: Outlet 2 (llll)
entry.description: The elements corresponding to negative durations (rest elements).

entry.name: Outlet 3 (llll)
entry.description: Indices of rest elements for future reinsertion.

entry.name: More details
entry.description: bach.toc&r is especially useful in combination with bach.fromc&r in order to perform different operations on the set of elements corresponding to rests and to non-rests.

entry.name: Keywords
entry.description: chord, rest, convert, route, divide, split, position, index.
